alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 7:59PM CST until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR THE FAILURE OF THE DAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a levee failure continues. * WHERE...A portion of eastern Arkansas, including the following county, Jackson. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 755 PM CST, Local law enforcement reported a failure of a levee near Pitts in Poinsett County on the Cache River. Additional flooding due to this levee failure may cause area roads to become impassable in parts of east central Jackson County, east of the Cache River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grubbs... Amagon... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
